msContents.summary: An illuminated black-paper manuscript of the Aparimitāyurdhāraṇīsūtra, a popular text containig the spell of Aparimitāyus. It is taught by the Buddha to Mañjuśrī in Śrāvastī. Those who recite, copy or worship this text are granted longevity and will be reborn in Aparimitāyus’ buddha-field.

msItem.title: Aparimitāyurdhāraṇīsūtra
Aparimitāyurdhāraṇīmahāyānasūtraratnarāja
Aparimitāyurnāmadhāraṇīmahāyānasūtra
Aparimitāyurnāmadhāraṇī
msItem.incipit: [1v1] evaṃ mayā [1v2] śrutam ekasmin samaya bhaga[miniature]vāṃ śrāvatyāṃ viharati sma || [1v3] jetavane anāthapiṇḍa:[miniature]syārāme mahatā bhikṣusaṃghe[1r4]na sārddhaṃ 'rddhatrayodaśa bhi[miniature]kṣuśataiḥ saṃbahulaiś ca bodhi[1v5]satvai mahāsatvai || tatra kha[miniature]lu bhagavāṃ maṃñjuśrīyaṃ kumā:[2r1]labhūtom āmantrayate sma || asti mañjuśrī bhūtā || ^ || paritā diśi apārami[2r2]tāyugunasaṃcayā nāma lokadhātus, tatra aparamṛtāyuḥjñānasuviniścitatejo r a ā [2r3]jāya tathāgatārhante samyaksaṃbuddho vidyācalanasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavid anuttaraḥ [2r4] puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devānāṃ ca manuṣyānāṃ ca buddho bhagavāṃ || ^ || evaṃ hi: [2r5] tiṣṭhati dhriyate jāpayanti e satvānāṃ ca dharmma deśayati ||
msItem.explicit: [19v3] idaṃm avocard bhagavānn ātamanā:[19v4]s te ca bhikṣavas, te ca bodhisatvāmahāsatva, sā ca sarvvāvatī patṣa sadevamanuṣāśuraga[19v5]ruḍa-gandharvaś ca loko bhagavanto bhāṣitam abhyanandann itiḥ || @ ||
msItem.finalRubric: [20r1] āryya apalimṛtāyu nāma dhālaṇī mahāyānaśūtraṃ samāptaḥ || @ ||

supportDesc.support:
Black paper. The recto of the first folio consists of an undyed layer.
6.7 15.5
supportDesc.condition: Complete, in good condition; slightly worm eaten on the right margin.

layout.p: 5 lines per page, approximately 30 akṣaras per line.
Double marginal frame lines in gold ink, ruling.
Folios 20v and 21 are blank with frame lines in the left and right margins; on folio 20, traces of ruling.

decoNote.desc: In 1v, an elaborately-painted picture of a Buddha holding a flower in a vase on his clasped hands (Bendall 1883: 38).
On the outer side of the front cover, traces of materials smeared on the manuscript during worship rites.

history.provenance:
Bought by Wright, Daniel Dr. D. Wright
in 1873-5.

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card for admissions procedures contact Cambridge University Library Admissions).
